title: Natural gas crucial for a low-carbon futureAs energy demand grows around the world, gas and LNG will be critical in the shift to a lower-carbon future. Electrification can only move so fast, and the adoption of emerging low-carbon technologies, such as hydrogen, is currently too slow to achieve net zero emissions by 2050. With coal still accounting for 30% of the world’s energy needs, shifting to gas as a transition fuel is a compelling option.
